thread.title: Shoppers left stunned after disoriented OTTER strolls into Tesco store
thread.title_full: Shoppers left stunned after disoriented OTTER strolls into Tesco store

author: mirror
title: Shoppers left stunned after disoriented OTTER strolls into Tesco store
text:
News Shoppers left stunned after disoriented OTTER strolls into Tesco store The juvenile otter clearly didn’t give a dam as he scuttled up and down shopping aisles just after 9am Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Tesco shoppers got more than their groceries this morning when they spotted a disoriented otter strolling around a store. 
The unusual sight attracted a crowd of onlookers at the supermarket in Castlebar, County Mayo. 
But the juvenile otter clearly didn’t give a dam as he scuttled up and down shopping aisles just after 9am, the Irish Mirror reported . 
The water-dwelling animal is thought to travelled to Tesco from nearby Lough Lannagh, crossing a number of busy roads along the route. Read More Family heartbroken by death of pet cat find out about his secret life in touching note from stranger The otter was spotted strolling around the Tesco store (Photo: YouTube/Darragh Mc Donagh) 
He made his way through the supermarket carpark before entering the grocery store through two sets of automatic doors, overtaking a number of early-morning shoppers as he went. 
The otter traversed a number of shopping aisles, closely followed by a crowd of curious customers, before a local resident covered him with his jumper and carried the animal outside. 
From there, he carried the otter back to Lough Lannagh but was bitten several times for his trouble. Read More Asda defends decision to refuse to serve mum-of-five six minutes before supermarket closed The juvenile somehow found its way into the aisles (Photo: YouTube/Darragh Mc Donagh) 
“The poor little guy was very difficult to hold. He was squirming and was clearly very distressed. But I knew if I dropped him anywhere short of the lake he’d be close to traffic,” said the resident, who wished to remain anonymous. 
“He got a hold of my finger at one stage and sank his tooth through my nail. I had to go to a GP for a tetanus shot afterwards but I guess it had to be done.” 
The otter was visibly relieved to find his way back to the water, and swam towards an area of the lake sheltered by reeds. 
Otters are members of the Mustelid family, which includes badgers, stoats, minks, and pine martens. They are nocturnal hunters and it is unusual to see them on land during the day. Read More Co-op forced to HIDE steak from customers - because they keep stealing it The unexpected visitor caused quite a stir (Photo: YouTube/Darragh Mc Donagh) 
A Tesco Ireland spokewoman said: "Tesco Ireland confirms a surprise visitor entered its Castlebar store this morning when an otter from a nearby lake appears to have taken a detour. 
"No contact was made with any foodstuffs during the incident. 
"However, as a precautionary measure store management have taken the necessary actions to thoroughly sanitise the area and is operating business as usual. 
"The otter was ushered safely from the store and returned to his natural habitat in a nearby lake." Like us on Facebook
